title: B1.1 Insights on Undergraduate Research at Utah Tech University
description: Join our panel discussion to learn about the benefits, challenges, and impact of undergraduate research on students and society. Hear about research opportunities currently happening at Utah Tech University.
presenters:
Moderator: Kathie Ott
Panelists: Rico Del Sesto, Aaron Davis, Sam Tobler, Ren Quinn

title: B1.2 Choosing the Right Degree for Pre-Med
description: Explore the various degree options available to students interested in pursuing a career in medicine. Join us to learn about the benefits, challenges, and prerequisites of different degree paths and get advice on selecting the best fit for your career goals.
presenters: Presenters: Jennifer Meyer, Heidi Heiner, Tracy Heatherington

title: B1.3 Discover the World of Science Based Internships
description: Our panel of experts will share their experiences and offer advice on how to find and apply for undergraduate science-based internships. Learn about the benefits, challenges, and impact of internships on your career, and get tips on how to make the most of these valuable opportunities.
presenters:
Moderator: Leann Weibert
Panelists: Greg Melton, Doug Sainsbury, Leann Weibert

title: B1.4 Level Unlocked: Tech Based Internships
description: Our expert panel shares their insights on how to find and apply for undergraduate internships in tech related fields. Learn about the skills, experiences, and opportunities that can help you succeed and advance your career in these in-demand areas.
presenters:
Moderator: Kim Bowler
Panelists: Jeremey Forsberg, Joe Francom, Scott Skeen
fields: ["Applied & Computational Mathematics", "Bioinformatics", "Chem/Biochem", "Computer Science", "Cybersecurity", "Design", "Engineering", "Information Technology", "Mathematics", "STEM Education", "Software Engineering"]

title: B1.5 Prompt Engineering and the Ethics of AI in Higher Education
description: Explore prompt engineering and the ethics of using AI in your educational journey. This presentation will address prompt engineering to support learning, responsible AI usage, potential biases, and strategies for fair and effective integration. Attendees will gain insights into the ethical considerations for use within academic environments.
presenters: Presenter: Curtis Larsen, Konnor Young

title: B2.1 Insights on Undergraduate Research at Utah Tech University
description: Join our panel discussion to learn about the benefits, challenges, and impact of undergraduate research on students and society. Hear about research opportunities currently happening at Utah Tech University.
presenters:
Moderator: Kathie Ott
Panelists: Rico Del Sesto, Aaron Davis, Sam Tobler

title: B2.2 Medical Based Graduate School Admissions
description: An overview of the steps involved in preparing to apply to medical based graduate programs (Medical, Vet, Dental, etc.). Topics will include identifying potential programs, selecting faculty advisors, crafting a strong application package, and understanding the admissions process.
presenters: Presenters: Jennifer Meyer, Heidi Heiner, Tracy Heatherington

title: B2.3 Discover the World of Science Based Internships
description: Our panel of experts will share their experiences and offer advice on how to find and apply for undergraduate science-based internships. Learn about the benefits, challenges, and impact of internships on your career, and get tips on how to make the most of these valuable opportunities.
presenters:
Moderator: Leann Weibert
Panelists: Greg Melton, Doug Sainsbury, Leann Weibert

title: B2.4 Level Unlocked: Tech Based Internships
description: Our expert panel shares their insights on how to find and apply for undergraduate internships in engineering and programming fields. Learn about the skills, experiences, and opportunities that can help you succeed and advance your career in these in-demand fields.
presenters:
Moderator: Kim Bowler
Panelists: Jeremey Forsberg, Joe Francom, Scott Skeen
fields: ["Applied & Computational Mathematics", "Bioinformatics", "Chem/Biochem", "Computer Science", "Cybersecurity", "Design", "Engineering", "Information Technology", "Mathematics", "STEM Education", "Software Engineering"]

title: B2.5 Data in All its Forms
description: Discover diverse academic paths in data-related fields at Utah Tech. This presentation will give students further information on majors on campus, differences in career opportunites, and the skills needed to succeed in the evolving data-driven landscape.
presenters:
Moderator: Dani Gutierrez
Panelists: Ren Quinn, Matt Harris, Helen Saar, Vinodh Chellamuthu

title: B2.6 Innovation Plaza
description: Atwood Innovation Plaza at Utah Tech boasts numerous resources and personnel a student or community member may need to either launch or grow their business. Come and learn - it's free to learn, free to innovate, free to gain consultation.
presenters: Presenters: Dr. Provost, Bonnie Jensen, Bailee Larkin

title: B2.7 Office Hours Unlocked: Your secret weapon for freshman success
description: Learn essential tips and strategies for freshmen to effectively utilize professor office hours - increasing academic success and building powerful connections with faculty.
presenters: Presenter: Christina Pondell

title: B3.1 Discovery and Design Day: How student projects embody active learning. active life.
description: Explore program showcase options available in various CSET programs. Students will learn about opportunities where they will be expected to showcase their work such as Design Day, Computing Showcase, Senior Project Exhibitions, Poster Sessions, Research Symposiums, etc. They will gain insight into the benefits of participating in these showcase events for their future career prospects.
presenters:
Moderator: Kim Bowler
Panelists: Sam Tobler, Rachel Ramsay, Vinodh Chellamuthu, Matt Kearl

title: B3.2 Future Proof Your Dreams: Medical school alternatives
description: Behind every first choice future is a solid backup plan. Explore best practices in creating strategic backup plans that can support your main goal of medical school, but also provide you with a plan B in case medical school acceptance doesn't pan out.
presenters: Presenters: Jennifer Meyer, Heidi Heiner, Tracy Heatherington

title: B3.3 Mastering Graduate School: Essential Skills for Non-Medical Grad Programs
description: An overview of the steps involved in preparing to apply to non-medical based graduate programs. Topics will include identifying potential programs, selecting faculty advisors, crafting a strong application package, and understanding the admissions process.
presenters:
Moderator: Dani Gutierrez
Panelists: Greg Melton, Jay Sneddon, Haylee Ream

title: B3.4 Why Do I Need GE: An exploration of the value add of professional skills and some of the best places to pick them up on the way to your degree
description: An exploration of the value add of General Education courses in the development of professional skills valued by employers. Use GE requirements to your advantage and shift your focus from "why do I have to do this" to "here's how I'm going to benefit from this".
presenters: Presenters: Sarah Black

title: B3.5 Building Your Portfolio
description: This lecture will focus on introducing undergraduate students to building effective portfolios to showcase their skills and work. Presenters will discuss strategies students can use from their first class to select and organize projects, present them appropriately for the intended audience, and tailor the portfolio to specific career goals.
presenters: Presenters: Jeremey Forsberg, Christina Pondell, DJ Holt

title: B3.6 Unlock Your Potential with "Your Career Plan"
description: Join your College of Science, Engineering, and Technology Career Coach to get an overview of self-exploration, career exploration, and career readiness. Learn how this process will help you discover your unique strengths, explore diverse industries, and gain practical skills. Explore Career Services resources, including coaching, career fairs, and networking opportunities, to help you confidently shape a successful future.
presenters: Presenter: Leann Weibert

title: B3.7 Inspiring the Next Generation of STEM
description: Explore innovative ways Utah Tech and you can inspire and engage the next generation of STEM students. Learn how you can become a mentor to encourage diverse perspectives and skillsets in STEM fields for kids K-12.
presenters: Presenters: Jessica Davis

title: B4.1 Career Exploration: Computer Engineering/Electrical Engineering/Mechanical Engineering/Mechatronics/APE
description: Learn about careers within Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, and Mechatronics including job requirements, necessary education, and available opportunities. Gain insight into the pathways associated with your desired field and learn how to tailor your education and experience to best prepare you for your desired career.
presenters: Presenters: Sam Tobler, Scott Skeen
